description.narrative: The project is designed to strengthen the existing communities# members to be highly effective and scalable model using the farmers# organizations, including the CFis as the primary vehicles to community#s led Self Help Responding to mitigating, adaptation and resilience, currently ATSA is implementing two projects # 1) Rural Ecological Agriculture for Livelihood (REAL) Project funded by the Field Alliance, Thailand based Grant Provider targeted Secondary Education in three districts in Kampong Chhnang province and three districts in Battambang province. The overall objective of the REAL project is to enhance communities to adopt less risky and pro-environment methods to their agriculture systems for sustainable livelihood. The main activities are training of trainer to the secondary school teachers and students on integrated Pest Management (IPM); Pesticide Impact Assessment (PIA); Agro-bio-diversity (ABD). And the second project is called Sustainable Intensification and Resilience Rice Field Fisheries(SIRRFF) funded by the FiA-EU aiming to improve food security from sustainable and diverse natural fish populations from floodplains and associated aquatic ecosystems of20 CFis in Prey Veng province. Groups (Saving for Change), expanding their access to capacity building in gender equity, the agriculture trainings and inputs, saving technologies, business skill and services, financial services while strengthening their claim decision making capacities and bolstering their roles within their households and communities. Saving groups with at least 50% women, harness the power of these groups through community led saving for change, collective sales and negotiation with buyers for marketingof agricultural products, small livestocks and aquaculture and ecological rice field fish habitats, and exchange of business and technical skills.

participating-org.narrative: ATSA is none governmental organization registered with the Ministry of Interior of the Government of Cambodia as an association under the name "Agriculture Technology Services Association" in March 2007. The idea of establishing ATSA arose from discussions between the National lntegrated Pest Management (lPM) Program and Danida on how the results obtained through the partnership could be sustained. In February 2016, ATSA decided to rqregister with the Ministry as a non-profit organization under the name "Agriculture Technology and Social Action Organization" after the passing of a new law on NGOs and Associations. There were two reasons for this decision: First, the new law made it illegal for associations tp receive donor funds. Secondly, the new name would better reflect ATSA's transformation from being just a provider of training courses to also being a proponent of social change through its work to empowervulnerable groups to take control of their own lives.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
